page.title: 06Kennethmont: Transport
page.content: Kennethmont is on the railway line between Inverness and Aberdeen but the trains no longer stop here.The main road is the B9002 which runs through the middle of the village,there are numerous minor roads which criss-cross the area.Most people have a car, but petrol is expensive here and vehicle maintenance costs are high.There is still a bus service but the buses are infrequent and as a result the service is under-used. Road maintenance is generally very good but some of the minor roads suffer occasionally from lack of attention, the main complaint being that roadside ditches are seldom cleaned out. During the Winter the main road is usually kept open in all but the most severe conditions, although there are usually complaints about the minor roads which are all too often left blocked.
